snippet: New York City is restoring the hulking apparatus for the primaries this week and any runoffs, but electronic voting is due back again for Election Day.
abstract: New York City will utilize aging lever voting machines for upcoming primaries, though electronic voting is due to return in time for November elections; 2012 elections were plagued by malfunctions in the electronic system, but several officials have expressed anxiety about whether the lever machines, purchased in the 1960s, will function properly either.
lead_paragraph: New York City is restoring the hulking apparatus for the primaries this week and any runoffs, but electronic voting is due back again for Election Day.

headline.main: Elections Board Rings In the Old, as Lever Machines Replace Scanners
headline.print_headline: City Rolls Out Its (Trusty?) Old Voting Machines
